channel.description: Better nannying for North Carolina starts here!

image.title: pumpkin picking – North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies

item.title: Pumpkin Picking (2022)
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Come join us again to pick pumpkins, learn about farming, and (most importantly) play in a giant dried corn pit! That's right, we are going pumpkin picking!
item.content:encoded:
Come join us again to pick pumpkins, learn about farming, and (most importantly) play in a giant dried corn pit! That’s right, we are going pumpkin picking!

Attend
Host
Share

Here are the outings that have been scheduled and sent to us, alphabetically by North Carolina region:

Triangle Region

When: Thursday, October 13, 2022 @ 9 am – 1 pm floating rescheduled due to weather to Thursday, October 20, 2022 @ 9 am – 1 pm floating

Where: Page Farms; 6100 Mt Herman Rd, Raleigh, NC 27617; +19195963227

Who: All caregivers and their children. Invitation extended especially – but not exclusively – to the members of the Triangle Nanny Tribe Facebook group.

Cost: There is a cost associated with this outing, and is to be paid directly to Paige Farm on arrival. Included in your admission fee is the free pumpkin that you pick.
â€‹
RSVP: On this Facebook event.

In a Different Region?

Volunteer as host for your region’s pumpkin picking during an October day! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster via webmaster@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area. And on top of that, we offer you a little something for being an organizer

All social events are volunteer hosted by nannies!

Spread the Word!

Share this image to your favorite social media outlet, and add the details of your local region’s Pumpkin Picking!

item.content:encoded:
Come join us again to pick pumpkins, learn about farming, and (most importantly) play in a giant dried corn pit! That’s right, we are going pumpkin picking!

Triangle Region

When: Wednesday, October 18, 2017 @ 10 am – 4 pm floating

Where: Ganyard’s Unchurch Farm; 2521 Louis Stephens Dr, Cary, NC 27519; (919) 886-9519

Who: All caregivers and their children, regardless of membership in the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies. (Non-members may wish to join the Friends of NC PAN listerv to be notified of other events like this that you can attend.)

Cost: There is a cost associated with this outing, and is to be paid directly to Upchurch Farm on arrival. Included in your admission fee is the free pumpkin that you pick.
â€‹
RSVP: Because we are attempting to track how many will be coming to see if we qualify for the discounted admission, we need you to RSVP! You may do so via Facebook or by leaving a comment on this post.

In a Different Region?

Volunteer as host for your region’sÂ pumpkin picking during an October day! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster viaÂ webmaster@ncpan.orgÂ to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area.

All social events are volunteer hosted by member nannies!

Spread the Word!

Share your region’s image to your favorite social media outlet, and add the details of your local region’s Pumpkin Picking!

item.title: (Triangle) Pumpkin Picking at Ganyard Hill Farm (2014)
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Come join us to pick pumpkins, learn about farming, and (most importantly) play in a giant dried corn pit! That’s right, we are going to Ganyard Hill Farm in Durham, NC! When: Monday, October 27, 2014 @ 10 am – 4 pm floating (That’s a teacher workday for any on the Chapel Hill/Carrboro City Schools […]
item.content:encoded:
Come join us to pick pumpkins, learn about farming, and (most importantly) play in a giant dried corn pit! That’s right, we are going to Ganyard Hill Farm in Durham, NC!

When: Monday, October 27, 2014 @ 10 am – 4 pm floating
(That’s a teacher workday for any on the Chapel Hill/Carrboro City Schools Calendar.)

Where: Ganyard Hill Farm;Â 319 Sherron Rd, Durham, NC 27703;Â (919) 596-8728

Who: All caregivers and their children, regardless of membership in the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies. (Non-members may wish to join the Friends of NC PAN to be notified of other events like this that you can attend.)

Cost: There is a cost associated with this outing, and is to be paid directly to Ganyard Hill Farm on arrival. If we can guarantee an attendance of 15 individuals, age 2-years-old and up, admission is only $10/person! Included in your admission fee is the free pumpkin that you pick.

RSVP:Â Because we are attempting to track how many will be coming to see if we qualify for the discounted admission, we need you to RSVP. Members, please RSVP [here]. Nonmembers, leave a comment with how many are attending. See the example comment, below.
